lines.text: The truth is just a lie that hasn't been found out.
[the Motorcycle Cop pulls Osterman over]
What's the trouble?
Can I see your license, please?
Yeah, I wasn't speeding though. I've given that up. You know I've cut, I've cut way back on speeding. I've cut, cut it way down.
Yeah I thought that was you, you write for TV, don't ya?
Yeah that's me. Yeah I'm, I'm on my way to catch a plane though, right.
Oh, don't worry, you'll make it. I like your stuff, Mister Osterman. Only sometimes I think you tend to be a little strident, ya know.
Strident? Are you giving me a ticket for strident writing are you? That means the death penalty for Beverly Hills parking violations is coming back too, huh?

[smiles]
Have a nice day.
Yeah.

What you've just witnessed is, in many ways, a life-sized video game. You saw a liar talk to a killer and you couldn't tell them apart. But hey, it's only television. As you may know, television programs are just the filler between attempts to steal your money. So if you want to save some, turn me off. It's a simple movement, done with the hand and what is left of your free will. The moment is now. My bet is you can't do it. But go ahead and try.
[beat]
Am I still on?

[the RV has just exploded, killing all four inside as Osterman and Tanner watch]
And then there were two.
John, time for a face to face.
And you will be showing me how to live.
How do you know so much?
I don't know so much. But I know you will be leaving me.
I'm still wondering how we got into this mess.
It's called being programmed.
Think of them as fleas on a dog hit by a car driven by a drunken teenager whose girlfriend just gave him the clap. It will help you sense of perspective.
I know Maxwell Danforth very well; he killed my wife. Not with his bare hands, of course. The Danforths of the world don't murder that way. They use words like terminate, exterminate.
Suppose I was to tell you that our enemies are capable of impairing rational thought, of dismantling our willingness to defend ourself, of dissociating whole societies from their value systems.
You mean they've got televisions.
